summary:
=== Purchase Information ===
Product Title: Penny Dreadful: The Complete Series
Review Date: 2017/12/17
Store: Rory Kinnear  (Actor),     Josh Hartnett  (Actor)    Rated:    NR    Format: DVD
Categories: Movies & TV, Paramount Home Entertainment, Boxed Sets
Product Description: ["Some of literature's most terrifying characters, including Dr. Frankenstein and his monster, Dorian Gray, and iconic figures from the novel Dracula are lurking in the darkest corners of Victorian London. They are joined by a core of original characters in a complex, frightening new narrative, where personal demons from the past can be stronger than vampires, evil spirits and immortal beasts. Relive every chilling episode of Showtime's Penny Dreadful if you dare."]
Average Rating: 4.7
Product Details: {'Genre': 'Television, Horror/Television', 'Format': 'AC-3, Box set, Dolby, Dubbed, Subtitled, Widescreen, NTSC', 'Contributor': 'Eva Green, Harry Treadaway, Rory Kinnear, Reeve Carney, Timothy Dalton, Josh Hartnett, Billie Piper', 'Language': 'English', 'Number Of Discs': '9', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'NR (Not Rated)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.7 x 7.5 x 5.4 inches; 9.74 Ounces', 'Media Format': 'AC-3, Box set, Dolby, Dubbed, Subtitled, Widescreen, NTSC', 'Run time': '24 hours and 22 minutes', 'Release date': 'July 18, 2017', 'Actors': 'Rory Kinnear, Josh Hartnett, Eva Green, Billie Piper, Harry Treadaway', 'Dubbed': 'Spanish', 'Subtitles': 'English', 'Studio': 'Paramount Pictures Home Entertainment', 'Country of Origin': 'USA', 'Number of discs': '9'}
Review Text: Excellent series. Really scary, superb acting and scenery. Too bad season 2 was too sexually graphic.
Review Title: Good series
Rating: 5.0
--------------------------------------------------
=== Purchase Information ===
Review Date: 2018/06/30
Average Rating: 4.4
Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Haifaa Al-Mansour'], 'Producers': ['Amy Baer', 'Alan Moloney', 'Ruth Coady'], 'Starring': ['Elle Fanning', 'Maisie Williams', 'Bel Powley'], 'Studio': ['IFC Films']}
Review Text: This is one of the best movies I have seen in a long time. I had no idea of the inspiration behind Mary Shelley's book Frankestein. It is remarkable how this intellectually gifted woman through life hardships could develop such book and character. Movie offers great depth. The actors are also remarkable
Review Title: I highly recommend it
Rating: 5.0
--------------------------------------------------
=== Purchase Information ===
Review Date: 2018/07/10
Average Rating: 4.6
Product Details: {'Audio languages': ['English Dialogue Boost: High', 'English', 'English Dialogue Boost: Medium'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Steven Spielberg'], 'Producers': ['Steven Spielberg', 'Amy Pascal', 'Kristie Macosko Krieger'], 'Starring': ['Meryl Streep', 'Tom Hanks', 'Sarah Paulson'], 'Studio': ['20th Century Fox']}
Review Text: A very self serving account. I read an article from the NY times debating the facts related in the movie. Nevertheless, it is a refreshing story of courage. I guess feminism is in vogue so the movie caters to it. I felt movie was very slow, making a bit boring on some portions.
Review Title: Not very impressed
Rating: 3.0
--------------------------------------------------
=== Purchase Information ===
Product Title: Bohemian Rhapsody
Review Date: 2019/03/26
Categories: Drama, Arts, Entertainment, and Culture, Bold, Electrifying
Product Description: ['Bohemian Rhapsody celebrates the band Queen, their music, and their extraordinary lead singer Freddie Mercury, who defied convention to become one of the most beloved entertainers ever.']
Average Rating: 4.8
Product Details: {'Audio languages': ['English', 'English [Audio Description]'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Bryan Singer'], 'Producers': ['Graham King', 'Jim Beach'], 'Starring': ['Rami Malek', 'Lucy Boynton', 'Gwilym Lee']}
Review Text: It is a sanitized version of Mercury's life. Not so accurate based on some reviews but it was great fun to watch. I love Queen's music. I would watch it again
Review Title: Great movie
Rating: 5.0
--------------------------------------------------

Review Text: I have read every Louise Penny book and was excited about Amazon producing the series. Sadly, the magic of her books: 3-Pines scenery, the epicurean delights, the nuance of the characters, the humor, are missing. The Cruelest Month has barely any resemblance to the book. It’s cheapened and lacks the sophisticated warmth so characteristic of Louise Penny.
Review Title: Disappointed
Rating: 2.0
--------------------------------------------------

Review Text: I have read every Louise Penny book and was excited about Amazon producing the series. Sadly, the magic of her books: 3-Pines scenery, the epicurean delights, the nuance of the characters, the humor, are missing. The Cruelest Month has barely any resemblance to the book. It’s cheapened and lacks the sophisticated warmth so characteristic of Louise Penny.
Review Title: Disappointed
Rating: 2.0
--------------------------------------------------
raw_response:
**Shopping Preferences and Patterns Summary:**

1. **Genre Preference**:
   - Strong inclination towards **horror** and **psychological thriller** genres, as evidenced by admiration for chilling narratives.
   - Enjoys **biographical dramas** and **historical accounts** that offer depth and intellectual stimulation.

2. **Rating Behavior**:
   - Consistently rates highly (4-5 stars) for engaging content, especially when it features strong acting and well-executed narratives.
   - Shows critical perspective on films perceived as slow-paced, overly graphic, or lacking originality.

3. **Cultural Interests**:
   - Exhibits a preference for **female empowerment** themes, indicated by appreciation for films that explore women's historical contributions.
   - Enjoys films addressing **courage** and **human resilience**, often driven by real-life events or characters.

4. **Quality of Production**:
   - Values **cinematography** and production quality; praises visual elements alongside performance.
   - Disappoints with subpar acting or poorly executed adaptations, particularly if the source material holds personal significance.

5. **Documentaries and Education**:
   - Engages with **documentaries** that challenge mainstream narratives, reflecting interest in uncovering lesser-known historical facts or stories.

Overall, this individual's preferences reflect a blend of entertainment seeking and intellectual engagement, with a keen eye for quality storytelling and character depth.

target_interaction.title: Love it
target_interaction.text: This my favorite season so far. Season 1 was great but Season 2 is the best. I can hardly wait for Season 3!
